Element: C. OTHER CONDITIONS AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE MARKETING AUTHORISATION
Text: C.   OTHER CONDITIONS AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE MARKETING AUTHORISATION

Element: ·Periodic Safety Update Reports (PSURs)
Text: ·Periodic Safety Update Reports (PSURs)

Element: The requirements for submission of PSURs for this medicinal product are set out in the list of Union reference dates (EURD list) provided for under Article 107c(7) of Directive 2001/83/EC and any subsequent updates published on the European medicines web-portal.
Text: The requirements for submission of PSURs for this medicinal product are set out in the list of Union reference dates (EURD list) provided for under Article 107c(7) of Directive 2001/83/EC and any subsequent updates published on the European medicines web-portal.

Element: The marketing authorisation holder (MAH) shall submit the first PSUR for this product within 6 months following authorisation.
Text: The marketing authorisation holder (MAH) shall submit the first PSUR for this product within 6 months following authorisation.

Element: ·Risk management plan (RMP)
Text: ·Risk management plan (RMP)

Element: The marketing authorisation holder (MAH) shall perform the required pharmacovigilance activities and interventions detailed in the agreed RMP presented in Module 1.8.2 of the marketing authorisation and any agreed subsequent updates of the RMP.
Text: The marketing authorisation holder (MAH) shall perform the required pharmacovigilance activities and interventions detailed in the agreed RMP presented in Module 1.8.2 of the marketing authorisation and any agreed subsequent updates of the RMP.

Element: An updated RMP should be submitted:
Text: An updated RMP should be submitted:

Element: ·At the request of the European Medicines Agency;
Text: ·At the request of the European Medicines Agency;

Element: ·Whenever the risk management system is modified, especially as the result of new information being received that may lead to a significant change to the benefit/risk profile or as the result of an important (pharmacovigilance or risk minimisation) milestone being reached.
Text: ·Whenever the risk management system is modified, especially as the result of new information being received that may lead to a significant change to the benefit/risk profile or as the result of an important (pharmacovigilance or risk minimisation) milestone being reached.

Element: ·Additional risk minimisation measures
Text: ·Additional risk minimisation measures

Element: Prior to launch of Zynteglo in each Member State the Marketing Authorisation Holder (MAH) must agree about the content and format of the educational and controlled distribution programme, including communication media, distribution modalities, and any other aspects of the programme, with the National Competent Authority.
Text: Prior to launch of Zynteglo in each Member State the Marketing Authorisation Holder (MAH) must agree about the content and format of the educational and controlled distribution programme, including communication media, distribution modalities, and any other aspects of the programme, with the National Competent Authority.

Element: The educational and controlled distribution programme is aimed at providing information on the safe use of Zynteglo.
Text: The educational and controlled distribution programme is aimed at providing information on the safe use of Zynteglo.

Element: The MAH shall ensure that in each Member State where Zynteglo is marketed, all healthcare professionals and patients/carers who are expected to prescribe, dispense and/or use Zynteglo have access to/are provided with the following educational package to be disseminated through professional bodies:
Text: The MAH shall ensure that in each Member State where Zynteglo is marketed, all healthcare professionals and patients/carers who are expected to prescribe, dispense and/or use Zynteglo have access to/are provided with the following educational package to be disseminated through professional bodies:

Element: ·Physician educational material
Text: ·Physician educational material

Element: ·Patient information pack
Text: ·Patient information pack

Element: The physician educational material should contain:
Text: The physician educational material should contain:

Element: oThe Summary of Product Characteristics
Text: oThe Summary of Product Characteristics

Element: oGuide for healthcare professionals
Text: oGuide for healthcare professionals

Element: oGuide for handling and method of administration.
Text: oGuide for handling and method of administration.

Element: ·The Guide for healthcare professionals shall contain the following key elements:
Text: ·The Guide for healthcare professionals shall contain the following key elements:

Element: oWarnings and precautions of the mobilisation agents and the myeloablative conditioning agent must be considered.
Text: oWarnings and precautions of the mobilisation agents and the myeloablative conditioning agent must be considered.

Element: oTreatment with Zynteglo in the clinical trials was associated with delayed platelet engraftment. No correlation was observed between incidence of bleeding adverse events (AEs) and time to platelet engraftment. Precautions regarding bleeding consequences of thrombocytopenia need to be taken. Patients should be made aware of the risk of bleeding events that are not easily identifiable, such as internal bleeding.
Text: oTreatment with Zynteglo in the clinical trials was associated with delayed platelet engraftment. No correlation was observed between incidence of bleeding adverse events (AEs) and time to platelet engraftment. Precautions regarding bleeding consequences of thrombocytopenia need to be taken. Patients should be made aware of the risk of bleeding events that are not easily identifiable, such as internal bleeding.

Element: oTreatment with Zynteglo is in theory associated with the risk of insertional mutagenesis, potentially leading to development of malignancy. All patients must be advised on signs of leukaemia and to seek immediate medical attention if these signs are present.
Text: oTreatment with Zynteglo is in theory associated with the risk of insertional mutagenesis, potentially leading to development of malignancy. All patients must be advised on signs of leukaemia and to seek immediate medical attention if these signs are present.

Element: oA negative serology test for HIV is necessary to ensure acceptance of apheresis material for Zynteglo manufacturing.
Text: oA negative serology test for HIV is necessary to ensure acceptance of apheresis material for Zynteglo manufacturing.

Element: oThe potential risk of loss of response to gene therapy may lead to loss of transfusion independence or increase transfusion needs for patients who did not reach transfusion­independence.
Text: oThe potential risk of loss of response to gene therapy may lead to loss of transfusion independence or increase transfusion needs for patients who did not reach transfusion­independence.

Element: oAll patients should receive annual monitoring of complete blood counts and total haemoglobin levels to monitor for leukaemia/lymphoma and maintenance of efficacy, respectively.
Text: oAll patients should receive annual monitoring of complete blood counts and total haemoglobin levels to monitor for leukaemia/lymphoma and maintenance of efficacy, respectively.

Element: oThe short-term potential risk of treatment with Zynteglo represents failure of engraftment, which shall be managed by administration of rescue cells.
Text: oThe short-term potential risk of treatment with Zynteglo represents failure of engraftment, which shall be managed by administration of rescue cells.

Element: oThe need to explain and to ensure that patients understand:
Text: oThe need to explain and to ensure that patients understand:

Element: –potential risks of treatment with Zynteglo
Text: –potential risks of treatment with Zynteglo

Element: –signs of leukaemia/lymphoma and what action to take
Text: –signs of leukaemia/lymphoma and what action to take

Element: –content of patient’s guide
Text: –content of patient’s guide

Element: –the need to carry the patient alert card and show it to every healthcare professional
Text: –the need to carry the patient alert card and show it to every healthcare professional

Element: –enrolment in the drug product Registry.
Text: –enrolment in the drug product Registry.

Element: oScope of the Registry and how to enrol patients.
Text: oScope of the Registry and how to enrol patients.

Element: ·The Guide to handling and method of administration for healthcare professionals shall contain the following key elements:
Text: ·The Guide to handling and method of administration for healthcare professionals shall contain the following key elements:

Element: oInstructions on receiving and storing of Zynteglo and how to check Zynteglo prior to administration
Text: oInstructions on receiving and storing of Zynteglo and how to check Zynteglo prior to administration

Text: oInstructions about the thawing of Zynteglo

Text: oInstructions on protective equipment and treatment of spills.

Text: The patient information pack should contain:

Element: oPackage leaflet

Text: oA patient/carer guide

Element: oA patient alert card.
Text: oA patient alert card.

Element: ·The patient/carer guide shall contain the following key messages:
Text: ·The patient/carer guide shall contain the following key messages:

Element: oTreatment with Zynteglo is in theory associated with the risk of development of malignancy. Signs of leukaemia and the need to obtain urgent medical care if these signs are present.
Text: oTreatment with Zynteglo is in theory associated with the risk of development of malignancy. Signs of leukaemia and the need to obtain urgent medical care if these signs are present.

Element: oPatient alert card and the need to carry it on their person and tell any treating healthcare professional that they were treated with Zynteglo.
Text: oPatient alert card and the need to carry it on their person and tell any treating healthcare professional that they were treated with Zynteglo.

Element: oThe potential risk of loss of response to gene therapy may lead to loss of transfusion independence or increase transfusion needs for patients who did not reach transfusion-independence.
Text: oThe potential risk of loss of response to gene therapy may lead to loss of transfusion independence or increase transfusion needs for patients who did not reach transfusion-independence.

Element: oThe importance of annual check-ups.
Text: oThe importance of annual check-ups.

Element: oTreatment with Zynteglo is associated with the risk of delayed platelet engraftment that could lead to an increased tendency for bleeding.
Text: oTreatment with Zynteglo is associated with the risk of delayed platelet engraftment that could lead to an increased tendency for bleeding.

Element: oSigns and symptoms of bleeding and the need to contact the physician if any signs of unusual or prolonged bleeding or any other relevant signs are present.
Text: oSigns and symptoms of bleeding and the need to contact the physician if any signs of unusual or prolonged bleeding or any other relevant signs are present.

Element: oEnrolment in the drug product Registry.
Text: oEnrolment in the drug product Registry.

Element: ·The patient alert card shall contain the following key messages:
Text: ·The patient alert card shall contain the following key messages:

Element: oInformation of risk of delayed platelet engraftment, potentially leading to bleeds, and theoretical risks.
Text: oInformation of risk of delayed platelet engraftment, potentially leading to bleeds, and theoretical risks.

Element: oStatement that the patient was treated with gene therapy and should not donate blood, organs, tissues, or cells.
Text: oStatement that the patient was treated with gene therapy and should not donate blood, organs, tissues, or cells.

Element: oStatement that the patient was treated with Zynteglo, including LOT number and treatment date(s).
Text: oStatement that the patient was treated with Zynteglo, including LOT number and treatment date(s).

Element: oDetails on reporting of adverse effects.
Text: oDetails on reporting of adverse effects.

Element: oInformation on the possibility of false positivity of certain commercial HIV tests because of Zynteglo.
Text: oInformation on the possibility of false positivity of certain commercial HIV tests because of Zynteglo.

Element: oContact details where a health care professional can receive further information.
Text: oContact details where a health care professional can receive further information.

Element: The MAH shall ensure that in each Member State where Zynteglo is marketed, a system aimed to control distribution to Zynteglo beyond the level of control ensured by routine risk minimisation measures. The following requirements need to be fulfilled before the product is prescribed, manufactured, dispensed and used:
Text: The MAH shall ensure that in each Member State where Zynteglo is marketed, a system aimed to control distribution to Zynteglo beyond the level of control ensured by routine risk minimisation measures. The following requirements need to be fulfilled before the product is prescribed, manufactured, dispensed and used:

Element: • Zynteglo will only be available through bluebird bio qualified treatment centres to ensure traceability of the patient`s cells and manufactured drug product between the treating hospital and manufacturing site. The selection of the treatment centres will be conducted in collaboration with national health authorities as appropriate.

• Zynteglo will only be available through bluebird bio qualified treatment centres to ensure traceability of the patient`s cells and manufactured drug product between the treating hospital and manufacturing site. The selection of the treatment centres will be conducted in collaboration with national health authorities as appropriate.

Zynteglo will only be available through bluebird bio qualified treatment centres to ensure traceability of the patient`s cells and manufactured drug product between the treating hospital and manufacturing site. The selection of the treatment centres will be conducted in collaboration with national health authorities as appropriate.
Text: Zynteglo      will only be available through bluebird bio qualified treatment centres to      ensure traceability of the patient`s cells and manufactured drug product      between the treating hospital and manufacturing site. The selection of the      treatment centres will be conducted in collaboration with national health      authorities as appropriate.

Element: ·Obligation to conduct post-authorisation measures
Text: ·Obligation to conduct post-authorisation measures

Element: The MAH shall complete, within the stated timeframe, the below measures:
Text: The MAH shall complete, within the stated timeframe, the below measures:

Element:
Description

Due date

In order to further confirm the appropriateness of the acceptance criteria, the MAH should re-evaluate the acceptance criteria for attributes related to potency tests using batch release data and clinical results after 6 months follow-up of 20 patients treated with commercial batches.

Interim report: at each annual renewal

When 20 patients have been treated with 6 months follow-up

Non interventional post-authorisation safety study (PASS): In order to further characterise and contextualise the long-term safety and efficacy of Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent β‑thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0 genotype, the MAH should conduct and submit the results of a study based on data from a product registry (REG-501) and use data on HLA‑matched allogenic HSCT treated patients from an established European registry as a comparator group.

Protocol submission: December 2020

Interim results:

- at each annual renewal

- Dec. 2024

- Dec. 2034

Final results: Q4 2039
Text: Description   Due date     In   order to further confirm the appropriateness of the acceptance criteria, the   MAH should re-evaluate the acceptance criteria for attributes related to   potency tests using batch release data and clinical results after 6 months   follow-up of 20 patients treated with commercial batches.      Interim report: at each annual renewal   When 20 patients have been treated with 6 months   follow-up     Non interventional post-authorisation safety study   (PASS): In order to further characterise and contextualise the long-term   safety and efficacy of Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with   transfusion-dependent β‑thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a   β0/β0 genotype, the MAH should conduct and   submit the results of a study based on data from a product registry (REG-501)   and use data on HLA‑matched allogenic HSCT treated patients from an   established European registry as a comparator group.   Protocol submission: December 2020  Interim results:  - at each annual renewal  - Dec. 2024 - Dec. 2034  Final results: Q4 2039

Element: E. SPECIFIC OBLIGATION TO COMPLETE POST-AUTHORISATION MEASURES FOR THE CONDITIONAL MARKETING AUTHORISATION
Text: E.    SPECIFIC OBLIGATION TO COMPLETE POST-AUTHORISATION MEASURES FOR THE CONDITIONAL MARKETING AUTHORISATION

Element: This being a conditional marketing authorisation and pursuant to Article 14(7) of Regulation (EC) No 726/2004, the MAH shall complete, within the stated timeframe, the following measures:
Text: This being a conditional marketing authorisation and pursuant to Article 14(7) of Regulation (EC) No 726/2004, the MAH shall complete, within the stated timeframe, the following measures:

Element:
Description

Due date

In order to confirm the efficacy and safety of Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent β-thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0 genotype, the MAH should submit interim and final data on Study HGB‑207

Interim results: at each annual renewal

Final results: December 2021

In order to confirm the efficacy and safety of Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent β-thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0 genotype, the MAH should submit interim and final data from patients with a severe non-β0/β0 genotype such as IVS-I-110 included in Study HGB‑212.

Interim results: at each annual renewal

Final results: December 2021

In order to confirm the efficacy and safety of Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent β-thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0 genotype, the MAH should submit interim data and the 5 years follow-up results of Study LTF-303.

Interim results: at each annual renewal

Final results: December 2024
Text: Description   Due date      In order to confirm the efficacy and safety of   Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent   β-thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0 genotype,   the MAH should submit interim and final data on Study HGB‑207   Interim results: at each annual renewal   Final results: December 2021     In order to confirm the efficacy and safety of   Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent β-thalassaemia   (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0 genotype, the   MAH should submit interim and final data from patients with a severe   non-β0/β0 genotype such as IVS-I-110 included   in Study HGB‑212.   Interim results: at each annual renewal   Final results: December 2021     In order to confirm the efficacy and safety of   Zynteglo in patients 12 years and older with transfusion-dependent   β-thalassaemia (TDT) who do not have a β0/β0   genotype, the MAH should submit interim data and the 5 years follow-up   results of Study LTF-303.   Interim results: at each annual renewal   Final results: December 2024
